image.altText: A black cat lies down on a towl with a cone around its neck.

props.synopsis: The RSPCA's ACT branch issues an appeal for information after multiple reported cases of animal cruelty in Canberra's north.

title.children: 'Incredibly cruel': Cats discovered with bound testicles in Canberra's north

image.altText: Autumn leaves on trees and path next to Lake Tuggeranong.

props.synopsis: The ACT Greens have committed to a range of measures to combat climate change, including establishing a Chief Heat Officer, planting more trees, and bringing back Canberra's iconic bus shelters, if elected in October.

title.children: ACT Greens say they will create Chief Heat Officer if elected in October

image.altText: A portrait of a doctor wearing a stethoscope around her neck, seated next to a desk.

props.synopsis: Junior doctors in Canberra worried that unpaid overtime was putting themselves and their patients at risk. They have now reached a settlement with the ACT government.

title.children: Junior doctors given $31.5 million after suing over unpaid overtime

image.altText: A portrait of a doctor in a consultation room.

props.synopsis: Health professionals and teachers want to do more to identify and help children and adults experiencing violence at home.Â

title.children: As many as one in two children are growing up in violent homes, research shows

image.altText: A woman with short grey hair stands at a lectern looking angry and hurt.

props.synopsis: When Harriet Spring publicly admitted she'd lost a $1.6 million inheritance to scammers, she had low expectations for both financial compensation and criminal consequences, but over the past week there's been progress on both fronts.

title.children: Woman who lost $1.6 million to scammers campaigns for change as seven people allegedly involved are arrested

image.altText: picture of a young boy on a mantel piece

props.synopsis: Tracey Paton watched her son wave goodbye on a hot summer's day as he promised to be home by lunchtime. A car crash later claimed his life.

title.children: After 24 surgeries and months in hospital, Tracey's 15-year-old son died from serious injuries sustained in a car crash

image.altText: A hospital building seen from across a busy road.

props.synopsis: A 73-year-old woman who weighed only 39 kilograms was prescribed paracetamol for a number of days before her death at Canberra Hospital in 2021.

title.children: Coroner finds paracetamol overdose partially to blame for grandmother's death in hospital

image.altText: Firefighters stand outside on a street near fire trucks.

props.synopsis: ACT police say a house fire in Spence, where one person was found dead, has been deemed suspicious.

title.children: Person found dead in Canberra house after 'suspicious' fire

image.altText: Soldiers in combat fatigues stand on a street at night

props.synopsis: At least 14 people have been killed in a series of fresh explosions targeting communications devices used by the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah. Follow live.Â

title.children: Fresh explosions in Lebanon hit Hezbollah hand-held radios, killing 14 and wounding hundreds

image.altText: Smoke billows from a small shop as people and fire-fighters stand outside it looking on

props.synopsis: A wave of fresh explosions hit hand-held radios used by members of the Hezbollah militant group in Lebanon.

title.children: Hezbollah walkie-talkies hit with explosions a day after pager attack

image.altText: Composite image of RBA governor Michele Bullock and US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell.

props.synopsis: As the US starts cutting interest rates, what does it mean for the Reserve Bank's fight against inflation?

title.children: The US has begun cutting interest rates. What does it mean for Australia?

image.altText: Portrait of woman sitting on a couch holding a white mug of tea

props.synopsis: When a town in Australia's South West was forced to switch off gas, residents were given a choice: use bottled gas or electrify. Now, electricity is providing more energy for Esperance than ever before and most of it is coming from renewable sources.

title.children: Forced to switch off gas, this small Australian seaside town became a 'microcosm of what the world is trying to do'

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaking publicly outdoors, wearing a suit with a yellow ribbon pinned on the lapel.

props.synopsis: We have reached that point in the political cycle where the parliamentary clock is running down, opinion polls are being taken more seriously, and various efforts are underway to define the ground on which the election will be fought.

title.children: Labor seeks the Coalition's soft underbelly as election battlelines take shape

image.altText: An Australian senator in a red jacket.

props.synopsis: Senators found many medical students get just an hour of training in the subject despite half the country going through it at some stage.

title.children: 'Irrational, hysterical or crazy': Senate inquiry recommends reproductive leave for all as it calls for medical profession to step up

image.altText: Men holding flags in front of the parliament 'Beehive' building.

props.synopsis: New Zealand has entered a period of right-wing politics, but the next generation of MÄori activists are ready to respond.Â

title.children: NZ is unwinding decades of 'race-based policies'. MÄori say it's taking away their rights

image.altText: Husic is sitting holding a pen, left arm braced against desk

props.synopsis: An offshore gas project slated for the New South Wales coast has been dealt another blow after Industry Minister Ed Husic issued a preliminary rejection.

title.children: Gas project at the centre of Scott Morrison's secret portfolio takeover scandal receives preliminary rejection

image.altText: A composite image of a statue of Jesus, a white cross, and piles of coffins.

props.synopsis: The high cost of burials is forcing Papua New Guinea families to abandon the bodies of loved ones at its public morgue, and many are ending up in mass graves.Â

title.children: High burial costs and a crowded public morgue could force Papua New Guinea to rethink its 'taboo' around death

image.altText: A man is handcuffed and walked down a street.

props.synopsis: The AFP says Jay Je Yoon Jung seemed surprised when he was arrested in a dawn raid. For nearly a decade he had operated the Ghost app with relative anonymity.

title.children: The 'socially awkward' karaoke lover who allegedly created an app for the underworld

image.altText: Protesters in high-vis wearing sunglasses hold signs and march

props.synopsis: Thousands of trade workers have walked off the job in Melbourne and Sydney to protest against the federal government's decision to force the CFMEU's construction arm into administration.

title.children: Thousands of workers march in Melbourne and Sydney against CFMEU administration

image.altText: Harris speaks into a microphone in front of a red American flag wearing a beige suit

props.synopsis: Kamala Harris's bid for the US presidency has become a key target of Russian disinformation campaigners focusing on the Democratic campaign, Microsoft says.

title.children: 'Hit-and-run' deepfake video targeting Kamala Harris was spread by 'Kremlin-aligned troll farm', Microsoft says

image.altText: CHILD CARE Anthony Albanese, Jason Clare

props.synopsis: The government asked the Productivity Commission to consider options for universal child care, but its preferred option is not cost-free for everyone.Â

title.children: Universal child care could be on the way, but it doesnât mean a free-for-all

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and James Marape at a Brisbane rugby league match in 2022.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese indicates Papua New Guinea is a step closer to entering a team in the NRL.

title.children: Albanese reiterates support for Papua New Guinea NRL club as talks continue with ARLC

image.altText: Jacqui Lambie parliament

props.synopsis: The review found a widely held perception that the military justice system was too closely linked to the defence force's top brass.

title.children: Lambie blasts government after royal commission accidentally leaks secret report

image.altText: A green crocodile leather bag sits on display in front of a vinnie's sign saying it's $2000

props.synopsis: A keen-eyed worker at an op shop spotted a "designer" find that retails for $4,000. The handbag, believed to have been made by luxury brand Balenciaga, was put on sale for half that price, but the store has received backlash on social media.

title.children: Op shop puts 'designer Balenciaga bag' on sale for $2,000, prompting backlash

image.altText: PROXY: Tupperware

props.synopsis: Tupperware Brands filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on Tuesday, giving in to dwindling demand for its once-iconic food storage containers and mounting financial losses.

title.children: Tupperware files for bankruptcy as its colourful containers lose relevance

image.altText: A group of men cross or raise their arms while standing in front of a makeshift blockade made of timber.

props.synopsis: There are concerns for dozens of Australian and New Zealander hikers on the Kokoda Track after local landowners set up a blockade, forcing authorities to suddenly close the famous route in Papua New Guinea.Â

title.children: Concerns for 'exhausted' Australian hikers as landowners form Kokoda Track blockade

image.altText: Albanese presser stern

props.synopsis: The federal government has failed to bring its first home buyer support scheme to a vote in the Senate, with the Greens and the Coalition voting together to delay consideration of the legislation for two months.

title.children: The government has been unable to bring on a vote that would have killed its own housing policy

image.altText: Toddlers play around a table. A mother is with her child, and a woman dressed in purple monitors.

props.synopsis: Nearly all families would benefit from a lift to childcare subsidies recommended by the Productivity Commission, with free care for low-income families.

title.children: Free child care for families earning under $80,000, landmark report recommends

image.altText: A still from a video appearing to show a fighter plane approaching another aircraft

props.synopsis: The 2022 incident involved a People's Liberation Army aircraft firing flares near the RAAF plane, before cutting in front of it and releasing "chaff" into its flight path.

title.children: Video emerges appearing to show 'dangerous' Chinese intercept of 'enemy' Australian aircraft

image.altText: A man is led out of a house in handcuffs.

props.synopsis: An Australian man has been arrested and charged over allegedly running an encrypted communications network tailored specifically for the use of criminal organisations.

title.children: Syndicate 'dismantled' as AFP raids target Australian creator of app for criminals

image.altText: A woman in a wedding dress and holding a bouquet stands beside a man in a jacket and tie outside a gift shop

props.synopsis: We've crunched the numbers for more than 43,000 job combinations and 2.8 million couples (including 31,600 same-sex couples). Turns out it's not just lawyers, doctors or teachers who stick to their own when it comes to love.Â

title.children: Who you'll probably marry, based on your job

image.altText: A blue board shows a photo of Epstein and Maxwell hugging, beside a series of dot-pointed text. A hand points to the photo..

props.synopsis: A three-judge panel ruled on Thursday to uphold Ghislaine Maxwell's sex trafficking conviction for helping the late financier Jeffrey Epstein abuse underage girls.

title.children: British socialite Ghislaine Maxwell denied appeal on sex trafficking conviction

image.altText: Pagers on display at a meeting room at the Gold Apollo company building in New Taipei City, Taiwan

props.synopsis: The use of pagers to attack members of the militant group Hezbollah has renewed focus on a device which stopped being widely used years ago.Â

title.children: The attack on Hezbollah brought pagers back into focus. So who is still using them in 2024?

image.altText: A tree silhouetted by the glowing pink lights of the aurora australis

props.synopsis: Get outside just as the sun is going down this evening to see the supermoon rising above the horizon.

title.children: The bright moon dulled last night's aurora. But expect a supermoon spectacle tonight
